Reviews.Author: Martine Irumva
Reviews.Content: it good!! the design, its light and screen its nice, the problem is the windows 8, many apps are not working and i tried all the ways to be able use them. all i got is microsoft is going through technical problems . am thinking to remove windows 8 and put windows 7

Reviews.Title: Decent buy
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: It's not the fastest thing in the world, but the battery life is decent and it's a good purchase for the price.

Reviews.Title: Unsure
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I wound up returning this laptop because it wouldn't boot.  I'll admit I'm not technologically savvy, but from my google research it looks like the hard drive wasn't formatted correctly at the factory or it was damaged in shipping (nothing was wrong with the box or casing of the laptop, though).  It seems to be a fluke, but I had a bad taste in my mouth and returned it instead of exchanging.I had bought the laptop on the recommendation of a friend, and she enjoys the laptop.  It's got great features for students and a nice price tag.  The only feature I didn't like about it in the brief time I had it was the track pad - I had to swipe across the track pad five times to move across the screen.  My friend uses a mouse instead, but that may not be practical for people who need a light laptop to travel with frequently.After reading several reviews and testing out ultrabooks at the store, I now have an Acer Aspire.  The track pad is noticeably better, but still not as good as several older laptops I've had.  It's also about $100 more, but I'm happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Nice light computer, lousy Windows 8, abominable service
Reviews.Author: Professor
Reviews.Content: Read at the end about my problems with this computer.I wanted a computer that is light weight and easy to bring with me.  Netbooks fit that class, except that the keyboard is so small that one can not touch type on it.  This machine is a great combination.  It has a normal size keyboard (no number pad, but do not need that here), nice size screen, and light weight.  Like an ultrabook, but at half the price.  My rationale in buying it is if it is too big and too heavy to shlep around, then I am not going to bring it, then why have it.The big problem is that when one travels, AND uses the machine for more than just internet communication, computer functionality is important.  And so is the size and the weight.  This machine does all that I need.  I am very impressed with it.On the negative side, there is no door or cover for the RAM or the harddrive.  If I were to go and put in a bigger RAM stick, I would have to take the whole bottom off, and that would void my warranty.Then the OS.  I know that Windows sells, but is ridiculous for a mouse driven laptop.  It is fine for a cell phone, but not for programming on a machine like this.  I wiped the hard drive, turned off UEFI, and then installed Opensuse 12.2 (12.1 does not have a driver for this new graphics chip).  It now works very well.On another side, the box said that the machine is "distributed by Lenovo" meaning that they did not make it.  Lenovo is a fine company and I expect that it is a well made machine, or they would not sell it.  I also note that Asus also makes an S400, but theirs has a touch screen and costs a whole lot more.  I do not need a touch screen so this is much better.  And I can not think of a higher quality computer manufacturer than Asus.One more point, the BIOS does not allow turning off the touch pad, and sometimes while typing it causes some funky things to happen (I might bump it).  I carry a mouse with me and do not like the touch pad.  And there are NO BIOS updates available from Lenovo for this machine.Just found out that I can turn off the key pad with F plus Fn keys.  Too bad that is screwed up now.UpdateThere were 4 keys that were dead, would not work.  This was from the beginning.  So, I tried plugging in a USB keyboard and everything worked fine, but the keyboard on the machine had the problem.Then I put in skype and the image looked like I was underwater, just blurry.so I sent it back under warranty.  I was told that it would be about 10 days.After 3 weeks I called and they had not even touched it yet.Called back in another week and they said that they put in a new motherboard and it is on the way.Well, it came back, and now it had six things wrong with it.  The novo button would not bring up the BIOS, but Fn and F2 together will within the first 1 second of boot up.  The BIOS says that the machine is an S405 but with an Intel chip.  Huh?The camera is not blurry now, it is dead.The F keys do what they are supposed to combined with Fn, but can not be used as F keys anymore.Should I go on.Yes, it went right back.  They paid the post for Fedex express.Now lets see what happens.I should have bought the optional insurance package when I bought it.  I have had Lenovo and Toshiba in the past and no problems.  I am very disappointed is all that I can say.I sent it back for the second time, less than a few hours after I got it.  I started calling after 3 weeks.  Did not get calls back.  I finally filed a formal complaint with the BBB.  That got me a response.  Promised me my choice of two machines in exchange.  Reviews on neither were very good.  Why go from the frying pan to the fire?I finally got it back from service after 6 weeks (now a total of 10 weeks).  The trim piece around the screen was falling off, just hanging there.  The Novo button will not depress and does nothing.  No more boot options.  At least it now now knows that it is an S400.  What else is wrong I have no idea at this time.  I plan to get rid of this machine.  Maybe round the corners and make it into a frisbee.My opinion (and nothing more) is that this is a nice machine, as long as you never let Lenovo service it.  This is based upon my experience of them breaking more than they fix every time it goes in, them taking ten weeks, and the lack of communication.

Reviews.Title: I keep buying them and they keep impressing me!
Reviews.Author: Amithus
Reviews.Content: I'm a corporate IT vendor in the Minneapolis MN area. I purchased one of these back in January for my staff member and one for myself. Both are working great still and bang for the buck, you can't beat it. Since then I have purchased over 20 of these for clients, all of which love this laptop and can't believe the price / quality.The Intel I3 processor with 4gb of RAM really make this a snappy laptop. The size is the best feature though. Extremely thin, light and powerful with an excellent battery life and small power adapter really round out this device.Windows 8 preforms nicely with this unit and overall this laptop is very future proof. Why purchase a Dell or HP (both of which I have purchased in the past 5 months) when you can get a Lenovo for a little over $400 with as much if not better customer service? Lenovo has really held up their end of the bargain when they purchased the Idea line from IBM.You will not be disappointed purchasing one of these laptops. As always, cleaning it up software wise before putting it in service is a smart thing to do and will make this run even better but for the first time I can say you don't need to do much. They don't load it up full of BS software just to make a quick dime from throwing bloatware in your face.Sleek and stylish, you will defiantly get a few questions about it when you use it too. I have probably sold another 50 by proxy, using it at meetings, conferences and other public places.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and fast
Reviews.Author: SHewett
Reviews.Content: I wanted a thin, light laptop for personal use so I wouldn't have to carry my work laptop home every night in case I wanted to log on for something. But I mainly use it for Facebook, checking email, browsing the web and listening to music. I love the light weight sleek design.  I'm still getting use to Windows 8 (works better for a touchscreen). The processor is fast. I have had no problems.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Touchpad too big and sensitive
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Guimaraes
Reviews.Content: The touchpad is super sensitive. While using a word processor and while browsing the internet, the zoom goes crazy! It's because my hand will rest on the front of the laptop, but the touchpad is so large that my hand ends up resting on it, and then when my other hand touches the right side of the touchpad, the zoom activates. It drives me absolutely crazy. It was especially distracting when writing a college paper. Plus, the right and left click are not actually separate buttons, and this makes it easy to press the wrong one.I dislike windows 8. I would recommend buying a computer with 7 unless there is some reason you need 8. It is unnecessary and complicates what couple be simpler. However, it is not awful.The battery is supposed to last 5 hours, but it does not. While browsing and using Hulu, I would say it lasts about 3 hours.The computer turns on in seconds. This is great! I've had it for a few weeks, and I still cannot get over how quickly it turns on!

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: D. B. W "DBW"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th note book, 2 from HP, 1 older Lenovo, 1 from E-Book years ago.Not sure how long it will last but as of now 3 weeks into it I can say, it's fast, light and does not heat up at all. Also looks good, very sleek, keyboard and keys very comfortable.Opens programs fast  I don't believe you can beat the price.Prior to this I always had 15.6 inch screens so I was not sure about the 14" but now I can say with out a doubt the 14" is just fine ,large enough and would not go back to a 15.6"I have no complaints Lenovo did a great job with the S400. Another great thing is  the S400 boots up with in seconds, amazing fast,As far as windows 8, I did not like the apps screen, to busy prefer the start button with all the information so I downloaded "shell" and  the look is the same as windows 7, I disabled the app screen, it was popping up and annoying. Microsoft should have given windows  8 an option to use a normal start screen instead of trying to be cool with apps, this is a computer not a tablet or phone, we have the use of the touch pad.At the moment I highly recommend the S400 ,

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: russruss
Reviews.Content: Works well.  Loaded Windows 7 and had problems with the screen being too dark.  Other people had similar problems so I reloaded Windows 8.  Wifi range is probably a little below average.  But still a good laptop for the $400 price.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Dutkiewicz "Becka"
Reviews.Content: I use it primarily for email, web-browsing and Skype. It is also capable of actually playing some games despite it having integrated graphics, including Minecraft at nearly maximum settings.Looks-wise it is extremely slim and has a very clear, mostly non-reflective screen. The boot-up time is quick and I've even come to like WIndows 8.All-in-all its a perfect laptop for my needs and didn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: xiaoman hu
Reviews.Content: this laptop works soooo fast and very light , i always want  a light computer and this one just surprise me with its weightlove it sooo much

Reviews.Title: Will not work with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Jordo
Reviews.Content: If you plan on using Windows 7 on this laptop it will not work. Windows 8 SUCKS, and I tried to put Win 7 on here. No drivers supported for Windows 7, I contacted Lenovo and they said I have to use Win 8.

Reviews.Title: not useful
Reviews.Author: Andrew Racicot
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my girlfriend, it looked like a good buy. Starting and setting up is business as usual, but once you're into it, you discover that some genius decided to load a tablet operating system on a laptop. This is less than useless, unless you have a touch screen, and even then it sucks. The lack of any form of optical drive takes away from the overall package as well, but it's fairly clear in the description that it will not have one, so if you need one, get an external, or get a different system. An available patch (?) makes things far easier by adding a start button and menu (completely lacking in win8), there are several of these, so you'll need to search for one and pick the one you like best. So what I'm saying is, WIN8 is a colossal mistake, but the computer seems good. Hard to tell with win8 in the way...Another problem with win8, it doesn't look like there's any outlook express version for this crappy os.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Lauren Broskow
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grandson who will be going to college soon.  He loves it.  The smaller size and light weight will allow him to easily carry it around while not loosing any processing speed and memory.  A good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Ariel Cohen "Foreign Policy Wonk"
Reviews.Content: Good laptop for the money. Bought it for my daughter's college work. Small enough to be transported in a backpack yet powerful enough for word processing, Internet, and an occasional movie.

Reviews.Title: Gift...no real feedback for it.
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Regretfully the purchase was a gift, but from what I hear the person is really loving it and enjoying it.  The pricing on it is what was key for a budget laptop that works for a college student.

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop On The Earth
Reviews.Author: KL
Reviews.Content: best laptop I have ever owned. It has a very long battery life. It lasted a whole 2 and a half hour flight with me watching movies.

Reviews.Title: great deal except...
Reviews.Author: Marc A. Spence
Reviews.Content: not happy with windows 8 experience. my son uses you tube alot and has viewing issues that i can only attribute to OS... would be perfect if you install windows 7 or other OS

Reviews.Title: Hands down the worst
Reviews.Author: spaceriker
Reviews.Content: This is the worst laptop you would get on the market for this price. There is a very cheap WLAN card on it, lousy touchpad with silly under the hood mouse-keys and an extra-glossy screen that makes working with it a nightmare.The battery backup isn't all that great too - unless you dim down the screen which at the lowest setting starts flickering.This is the cheapest junk out there which does not deserve to be on sale at all.To top it all, Lenovo has tried to lock this thing down completely so that you can't install a new WLAN card and can't flash the BIOS to update the image.Please do not buy.
